page.title: 10SCHOOL TRANSPORT
page.content: We need school buses so that children in outlying villages can get to school from their homes . The LEA provides school buses for those who live beyond a certain distance from the school.There are two buses starting from Hardwick and Everesden picking up children from Kingston and Toft on their way in. Those who live outside the catchment area must supply their own transport or go to a different school. The LEA gives you an free yearly or termly pass to use on these buses. We have used school buses for fifteen years since 1970 when the school opened.The children who come on school buses often find it difficult to stay for after-school activities, unless their parents come to collect them. The school buses we use are, WHIPPIT, MYALLS and CAMBUS.
